#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Thirteen Martyrs of Bagumbayan
#Text=Historical marker installed by the National Historical Institute in Rizal
#Text=Park to commemorate the martyrs .

#Text=The Thirteen Martyrs of Bagumbayan ( Spanish : Trece mártires de Bagumbayan ) were Filipino patriots in the Philippines who were executed by musketry on January 11 , 1897 , for cooperating with the Katipunan during the Philippine Revolution against Spain . [ 1 ]
#Text=The Martyrs
#Text=Jose M. Dizon - was a Filipino patriot who was among those who founded the Katipunan that sparked the Philippine Revolution .
#Text=Dizon was born in Binondo , Manila .
#Text=In April 1892 , he was inducted into the freemasonic lodge founded by Pedro Serrano Laktaw .
#Text=That same year , he founded the lodge Taliba in Trozo , Manila and served as its venerable master .
#Text=He was also among the officers of the grand regional council that included Apolinario Mabini .
#Text=Domingo Franco - Born in Mambusao , Capiz , Franco was the third among the six children of Juan Franco and Ciriaca Tuason .
#Text=His father worked as procurador judicial , or solicitor , in the local justice of the peace court .
#Text=He kept in his care the documents of the La Liga Filipina as ordered by Jose Rizal . [ 2 ]
#Text=Numeriano Adriano - A reformist , Adriano was one of those executed by the Spaniards soon after the revolution in 1896 broke out .
#Text=He was the eldest of the seven children of Pioquinto Adriano and Agapita Resurreccion of Beata , Pandacan , Manila .
#Text=Adriano enrolled in the University of Santo Tomas , but it is not known whether he finished a degree .
#Text=For twenty years , he worked in the third branch of the Court of the First Instance as clerk of court .
#Text=Moises Salvador - was a contractor , mason , and propagandist .
#Text=Salvador was born in San Sebastian which was formerly a part of Quiapo , Manila .
#Text=He was the son of Ambrosio Salvador , founding president of the La Liga Filipina , and Acosta Francisco .
#Text=Faustino Villaruel - a merchant from Pandacan , Manila .
#Text=A mason and one of the founding member of the La Liga Filipina , and supporter of the propaganda movement .
#Text=Francisco L. Roxas - was a businessman , musician and a second cousin of one of the richest men in the Philippines at that time , Don Pedro Pablo Roxas .
#Text=He was born in Binondo , Manila .
#Text=Luis Enciso Villareal - was a member of the Propaganda Movement .
#Text=Villareal was born in Daraga , Albay .
#Text=His father , Francisco Villareal , was known to be a “ wonderful fiddler ” and a graceful dancer .
#Text=Meanwhile , his mother was Maria Espinas .
#Text=His parents own an abaca plantation .
#Text=He was initially enrolled in the town school but was later sent to a seminary in Naga City where he finished with a bachelor of arts degree .
#Text=Geronimo M. Cristobal - He was an infantry corporal in the regiment known by the nickname “ Burgos . ”

#Text=As he stood there facing the array of guns pointed menacingly at him and his companions , he must have thought it rather unreal that he should meet his fate at the hand of his former comrades-in-arms , some of whom could be his friends .
#Text=Antonio Salazar - Salazar y San Agustin was one of the 13 Masons and revolutionaries who were executed by the Spanish authorities .
#Text=Ramon Padilla - Padilla at the time of the outbreak of the Revolution in 1896 was said to be a clerk at the Comandancia de la Marina ( Navy ) .
#Text=Braulio Rivera - Born in Gitna ( now renamed after him ) , Tondo , Manila near the corner of Zabala and Sto .
#Text=Cristo Streets .
#Text=Rivera was the son of Jose Rivera , a worker at the tobacco monopoly administration .
#Text=Little is known of his early background : although only an elementary graduate , he was employed as a clerk at the “ Sub-inspeccion General de Montes ” .
#Text=He was blessed with an exceptional singing voice thus , was inclined to singing .
#Text=He was also an able musician who played three instruments - the guitar , violin and flute .
#Text=Faustino Mañalac - He was a clerk in the Port of Manila administration and headed the Ilog Pasig council of the KKK in Binondo .
#Text=A son of a carpenter at the naval shipyard in San Roque , Cavite , he became a member of the KKK Supreme Council using the alias " Mayon " .

#Text=Married to Marta Saldaña , who was a member of the KKK women 's section along with Gregoria de Jesus , Maria Dizon , Josefa and Trinidad Rizal , Mañalac is listed among those who visited the Pamitinan caves with Andres Bonifacio , Emilio Jacinto , Aurelio Tolentino , Guillermo Masangkay on Good Friday , 1895 and wrote about Philippine independence on the walls of the cave . [ 3 ] [ 4 ]
#Text=Benedicto P. Nijiga - During a raid of a printing press in Binondo , the Spaniards found and confiscated subversive documents including a list of members of the Katipunan .
#Text=Benedicto Nijaga was on the list as a collector of revolutionary funds .
#Text=Upon the order of Gov. Polavieja to arbitrarily arrest all suspected members of the Katipunan , Nijaga was arrested while he was campaigning for revolutionary funds .
#Text=He is one of the notable people of Calbayog . [ 5 ]
